labels.analysis: The YNAB Server is designed to provide a standardized interface for managing YNAB (You Need A Budget) functionality. Its core purpose revolves around financial management, particularly budgeting and transaction handling. The available tools allow users to view account balances, create and query transactions, manage budgets, and retrieve categorized financial data. This makes it highly focused on personal finance and budgeting, with a strong emphasis on data retrieval and transaction management.
labels.reasoning: The primary label of "Financial Services" is chosen because the server's primary functionality revolves around budgeting, transaction management, and account balances, which are core aspects of personal finance. The secondary label of "Data Analysis & Processing" is included because the server retrieves and organizes financial data, which could be useful for analytical purposes. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

server_info_crawled.name: YNAB Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Meh-S-Eze/ynab-mcp-client2
server_info_crawled.overview: Access YNAB functionality seamlessly through a standardized interface. Manage your budget by viewing account balances, creating transactions, and retrieving data effortlessly. Enhance your financial management with easy integration into your applications.

tools.name: create_transaction
tools.description: Deploy Server YNAB Server Claim Server @Meh-S-Eze/ynab-mcp-client2 Try in Playground create_transaction

tools.name: get_account_balance
tools.description: Get the current balance of a YNAB account (in dollars).

tools.name: get_budgets
tools.description: List all YNAB budgets in Markdown format.

tools.name: get_accounts
tools.description: List all YNAB accounts in a specific budget in Markdown format.

tools.name: get_transactions
tools.description: Get recent transactions for a specific account in a specific budget.

tools.name: get_transactions_needing_attention
tools.description: List transactions that need attention based on specified filter type in a YNAB budget.

tools.name: _find_transaction_by_id
tools.description: Find a transaction by its ID and ID type.

tools.name: get_categories
tools.description: List all transaction categories for a given YNAB budget in Markdown format.

tools.name: set_preferred_budget_id
tools.description: Set the preferred YNAB budget ID.

tools.name: cache_categories
tools.description: Cache all categories for a given YNAB budget ID.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Meh-S-Eze/ynab-mcp-client2/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: ynabApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: YNAB API key for authenticating requests
